medical_history.chief_complaint: Complete hypogonadotropic hypogonadism with primary amenorrhea and lack of secondary sexual characteristics.
medical_history.history_of_present_illness: The patient came to medical attention in 1991 at age 16.8 years with symptoms of primary amenorrhea. Initial laboratory tests revealed low estradiol and gonadotropin concentrations. Treatment with estrogen and progestogen led to withdrawal bleeding and development of secondary sexual characteristics.
medical_history.family_history: The patientâ€™s mother had normal pubertal development and regular menstrual cycles. A fertile 26-year-old sister and a clinically normal 22-year-old brother were also mentioned.
